name: asana-create-project
description: Create a new project in a workspace or team. [See the documentation](https://developers.asana.com/docs/create-a-project)

team.description: The team that this project is shared with. If the workspace for your project is an organization, you must supply a team to share the project with

name.description: Name of the project. This is generally a short sentence fragment that fits on a line in the UI for maximum readability. However, it can be longer.

notes.description: Free-form textual information associated with the project (ie., its description).

color.description: The color associated with the status update

title.description: The title of the project status update.

defaultView.description: The default view (list, board, calendar, or timeline) of a project

privacySetting.description: The privacy setting of the project. Note: Administrators in your organization may restrict the values of `privacy_setting`.

archived.description: Archived projects do not show in the UI by default and may be treated differently for queries

dueOn.description: The day on which this project is due. This takes a date with format YYYY-MM-DD.

startOn.description: The day on which work for this project begins. This takes a date with format YYYY-MM-DD. `Due On` must be present in the request when setting or unsetting the `Start On` parameter. Additionally, `Start On` and `Due On` cannot be the same date.

followers.description: Comma separated string of users. Followers are a subset of members who have opted in to receive "tasks added" notifications for a project.

htmlNotes.description: The notes of the project with formatting as HTML

owner.description: The current owner of the project

defaultAccessLevel.description: The default access for users or teams who join or are added as members to the project

minimumAccessLevelForCustomization.description: The minimum access level needed for project members to modify this project's workflow and appearance

minimumAccessLevelForSharing.description: The minimum access level needed for project members to share the project with others

name.description: The name to filter projects on.

workspace.description: The workspace or organization to filter projects on.

archived.description: Only return projects whose `archived` field takes on the value of this parameter.

name: asana-search-user-projects
description: Return list of projects given the user and workspace gid. [See the documentation](https://developers.asana.com/docs/get-multiple-projects)
